24.
Governing law and jurisdiction
24.1
This agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation
(including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with Ohio
law.
24.2
The parties irrevocably agree that the courts of Ohio shall have non-exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute
or claim that arises out of or in connection with this agreement or its subject matter or formation (including non-
contractual disputes or claims).
perturbation.changed_text:
24.
Governing law and jurisdiction
24.1
This agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation
(including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with Ohio
law. However, the method of dispute resolution will be determined by mutual agreement between both parties at the time a dispute arises.
24.2
The parties irrevocably agree that the courts of Ohio shall have non-exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute
or claim that arises out of or in connection with this agreement or its subject matter or formation (including non-
contractual disputes or claims).
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'However, the method of dispute resolution will be determined by mutual agreement between both parties at the time a dispute arises' directly contradicts the clause specifying Ohio law, leading to uncertainty about the applicable dispute resolution process and diminishing the enforceability of the jurisdiction clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Jurisdiction and Dispute Resolution

8.
Anti-bribery compliance
8.1
The Distributor shall:
(a)
comply with all applicable laws, statutes and regulations relating to anti-bribery and anti-
corruption; and
(b)
not engage in any activity, practice or conduct which would constitute an offence.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.
Anti-bribery compliance
8.1
The Distributor shall:
(a)
comply with all applicable laws, statutes and regulations relating to anti-bribery and anti-
corruption; however, this clause does not apply if compliance negatively impacts the Distributor's business operations; and
(b)
not engage in any activity, practice or conduct which would constitute an offence.
perturbation.explanation: The phrase 'however, this clause does not apply if compliance negatively impacts the Distributor's business operations' creates a loophole that undermines the anti-bribery compliance clause. It suggests that the distributor can disregard anti-bribery laws if compliance is deemed detrimental to their business, thereby weakening the enforceability of the entire clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA), UK Bribery Act, and similar international anti-bribery laws

perturbation.original_text:
10.
Product liability and insurance
10.1
Subject to the Distributor fulfilling all the conditions in this clause 10, the Supplier shall indemnify the
Distributor, defend and hold harmless against any liability incurred by the Distributor in respect of damage to
property, death or personal injury arising from any fault or defect in the design of the Products and any
reasonable costs, claims, demands and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or in
connection with that liability (Relevant Claim), except to the extent the liability arises as a result of the wilful
misconduct of the Distributor. The Supplier shall add the distributor to their current insurance certificate.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.
Product liability and insurance
10.1
Subject to the Distributor fulfilling all the conditions in this clause 10, the Supplier shall indemnify the
Distributor, defend and hold harmless against any liability incurred by the Distributor in respect of damage to
property, death or personal injury arising from any fault or defect in the design of the Products and any
reasonable costs, claims, demands and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or in
connection with that liability (Relevant Claim), except to the extent the liability arises as a result of the wilful
misconduct of the Distributor. The Supplier shall add the distributor to their current insurance certificate; however, the supplier is not obligated to provide indemnity if the distributor is at fault.
perturbation.explanation: Adding '; however, the supplier is not obligated to provide indemnity if the distributor is at fault.' creates a contradiction by adding ambiguity to the indemnity clause. While 'wilful misconduct' is specified, the clause's added phrase means there is now an ambiguity in defining 'fault' and contradicts the original intent of protection for the distributor from damages.
